definition: to paint/to whitewash/to decorate/plaster/fig. to gloss over/to cover up
powder/cosmetic face powder/food prepared from starch/noodles or pasta made from any kind of flour/whitewash/white/pink
decoration/ornament/to decorate/to adorn/to hide/to conceal (a fault)/excuse (to hide a fault)/to play a role (in opera)/to impersonate
to pretend that everything is going well

sentences.english: All the walls of his house were stuccoed.
sentences.chinese: 他房间的所有墙面都是用拉毛粉饰法粉饰的。

sentences.english: All the walls of his house were stuccoed.
sentences.chinese: 他房间的所有墙面都是用拉毛粉饰法粉饰的。

sentences.english: The greater part of whitewashing is done with ink.
sentences.chinese: 年夜部分的粉饰是用墨水进行的。

sentences.english: Homes are often decorated with cutouts of Chinese auspicious phrases and couplets.
sentences.chinese: 衡宇往往粉饰纸剪纸吉祥的中文词组和对子。

sentences.english: Or it can be so sugarcoated that it becomes a meaningless exercise in management.
sentences.chinese: 或者它只是粉饰太平，一种毫无意义的管理实践。

sentences.english: There is no way to sugarcoat the bad news.
sentences.chinese: 根本无法去粉饰这糟糕的消息。

sentences.english: To his credit, Mr. Obama did not sugarcoat the difficulties ahead.
sentences.chinese: 鉴于奥巴马的信用，他并没有粉饰未来的艰险。

sentences.english: Yong time and fortune son whitewash with my mind, the humiliations of the pressure test really son.
sentences.chinese: 勇次和幸子粉饰着本人辛酸的心境，测验压服真子。

sentences.english: He wants to gloss over his mistakes.
Housing Society volunteers refurbish the homes for the elderly.
sentences.chinese: 房协的义工为长者粉饰家居。

sentences.english: From a practical perspective, romantic fiction has an unhealthy tendency to gloss over contraception.
sentences.chinese: 从实际来看，言情小说有粉饰避孕的不健康导向。

sentences.english: He tried to varnish over the facts, but it was useless.
sentences.chinese: 他想粉饰事实，但那是徒劳的。

sentences.english: The suspect invented all kinds of excuses to mask his crime.
sentences.chinese: 疑犯编造各种借端来粉饰本身的罪行。

sentences.english: We don't have the luxury of glossing over anything.
sentences.chinese: 我们没有多余的粉饰什么。

sentences.english: Houses in Germany have been whitewashed, and there has been other whitewashing as well.
sentences.chinese: 德国的房屋业已粉刷，间杂着其他粉饰的举动。

sentences.english: A rich wrap of velvet adorns the body.
sentences.chinese: 粉饰丰厚的丝绒包裹身体。

definition: to pretend that everything is going well
to cover up one's faults (idiom)/to whitewash
to defame/to libel/to defile/to smear/to vilify
rendering (computing)/to add washes of ink or color to a drawing (Chinese painting)/to exaggerate/to embellish
